inn1.comm: gentle shape to start, a tad wide outside off. Masakadza shoulders arms
a touch closer but still too wide outside the off stump, he leaves again
good length, but a lot wider outside the off stump, another comfortable leave
makes him play this time, he brings it closer to Masakadza from back of a length and it is pushed into the cover region
brings it closer again, good length and blocked back to the bowler
just a touch fuller and wide outside off, Hamilton gets a good stride forward and lets it go harmlessly. Maiden to start
tossed up outside off and induces the drive, gets a thick outside edge which flies down to the third man boundary, pulled back just inside
flighted well outside off, another expansive drive, which finds cover point
flatter and straighter, hitting off stump, blocked off the front foot
tossed up again, driven off the front foot with the turn towards midwicket
goes on with the arm this time, slightly wide outside off on a good length, beats the bat
tossed up on off stump, punched back hard in to the ground but the bowler can stop it from going past him
well bowled, just a tad wide outside off and gentle away movement. Chibhabha gets forward and shoulders arms
flirts with it this time, away movement again and a bit wide, Chibhabha prods at it and plays it to point with a half-bat
closert o the off stump on a good length, defended off the front foot back to the bowler
that is much better, fuller and on middle, and seams away just a bit, Chibhabha is opened up but he is able to drive it towards mid-on
better from Chibhabha. Good length ball just outside off, blocked off the front foot
fuller again on middle stump, Chibhabha gets forward and skews it off to mid-on off the front foot
pushes it across the batsman to start, Masakadza picks the movement and leaves well

excellent short delivery from Mitchell McClenaghan. Banged in on leg stump and directed to perfection. Right at the badge too, Masakadza awkwardly defends off the front foot with his right foot in the air and it kisses his glove and lobs neatly to second slip. Great start for NZ.
peach of a ball, pitches on off stump and moves away from him and beats him all ends up
smashed on the helmet, he tries to duck under it and instead gets clipped on the helmet. Not that short but he prefers to try and go under it, didn't work
length ball on middle stump, he misses it and is beaten on the body and it rolls away towards square leg
good finish, back of a length again, Ervine stays in his crease and leaves it well this time
good shot, slightly overpitched and on middle stump, neatly flicked off the front foot into the gap at midwicket and it races across to the boundary
even better this time, poor ball however, short and wide and punished. Chibhabha stays in his crease and cuts it beautifully into the gap at cover point
immediately tightens his line, brings it closer to off stump from a back of a length, blocked back to the bowler
too leg side again, easy pickings, slightly fuller and whipped away off his pads easily behind square leg, which is the third boundary of the over
drifts down leg again and full, clips Chibhabha's pads on the way to the keeper, would have been called wide if no pad
bangs it in this time, Chibhabha anticipates it and gets under it without harm
hit on the helmet again, a lot of uncertainty in his footwork, back of a length again and not much bounce. Takes his eyes off the ball and is smashed again.
better this time, similar ball outside off, and back of a length again, left well off the back foot
superb shot, good stride forward and drives it delectably through the covers, A bit too full and wide, probably a result of the bouncers but Ervine is upto it and hits it well
touch shorter again, Ervine is happy with this length now, gets on the back foot and guides it to point
great stuff from McClenaghan, persisting with that shorter length and it is rising too, Ervine drops his hands well and lets it go
left with intent from Ervine. Slightly fuller but wide and Ervine sees no reason to play and hence, shoulders arms
back of a length on off stump, good ball from Henry. Chibhabha defends with a straight bat back to the bowler
good length again, Chibhabha isn't too troubled with this length though. Pushes it off the front foot to mid-on
that length may trouble him, bouncer outside off, Chibhabha is able to get well under it though
good length but on middle and leg, turned away off the front foot to square leg
slightly short, doesn't get up that high though, Chibhabha is on his toes and works it effectively off his ribs to square leg
good finish, good adaptation to the left-hander too, back of a length just outside off, Ervine is content to leave
pitches it short on off stump, Chibhabha is on his toes once more and guides it off the back foot to point who makes a good, diving stop

what happened there? Shorter length again but much closer to the body, Chibhabha awkwardly gets up and is hit on the wrist band on his arm and a bit of bat handle too, it races across to square leg but hauled in well inside
slightly fuller on a fifth stump line, Ervine steers it off the front foot towards backward point
hits him on the hand again, pitches it halfway down the track and it gets up to hit Chibhabha on his glove as he tries to defend off the back foot.
appeal for a strangle down the leg side, shorter length again but drifts down the leg stump, Chibhabha tries to flick but no connection. Called wide
there it is, the fuller ball and wide to induce the drive, Chibhabha obliges and smashes it through covers without much feet movement. Gets it through but a good ball, the short ball barrage worked
back of a length outside off which is elegantly cut away but straight to point
gentle pace on off stump, just a touch of in swing to the left-hander , played to cover point
drifts down leg this time, Ervine misses the tuck off his pads, misses out on some runs too
punished this time, short, wide and banished. Too slow and cut away behind point for four
fuller and some gentle in swing, pushed off the front foot to cover
very slow outside off, Ervine stays on the back foot and lofts it over the infield and it goes over point. Pulled back just inside the boundary
poor ball to the right-hander, drifts it down leg stump and Chibhabha neatly tickles it off to the fine leg boundary. Zimbabwe will be happy with that over
shorter length just outside the off stump, Ervine stays on his back foot and blocks well
he persists with that length, but changes the line a tad towards middle and leg, blocked off the front foot once more
a slight change in action, but bangs it in halfway down outside the off stump, harmlessly let go by Ervine after dropping his hands
good length on a fourth stump line, Ervine plays it with soft hands down, hardly leaves the square
bouncer, but very short, won't be too much trouble for Ervine. He sees it early and gets easily under it
good-looking shot, stays on his back foot and punches the back of a length delivery to cover point
good length, a lot fuller and Ervine is upto it once more, gets a good forward stride and defends to cover
fuller and closer to off stump, Chibhabha opens the face of the bat and guides it through cover
gentle shape into Ervine, played away to mid-on off the front foot with the angle
fuller length on middle stump, Ervine stays on the front foot and pats it to cover
looks to drive through mid-off this time, comes in with the angle again and it is a bit fuller. He skews it back to the bowler

gone this time, big wicket for NZ. Elliott was bringing it in to the left-hander with the angle from the around wicket, a touch fuller this time and beats Ervine's defensive prod. The ball creeps between bat and pad and knocks back off stump. Great stuff from Elliott, stuck with that angle with some good lines.
away seam movement from the right-hander, very wide though, almost called a wide too. Chakabva lets it go
lands it well outside off and goes wider with the turning legspin, cut away off the front foot to the gap at cover
a bit too wide again from Sodhi, Chakabva stays on the back foot and cut it easily to sweeper cover
lands it beautifully this time, on middle and leg and it spins away as Chakabva blocks off the front foot
a touch fuller but good line just outside off, defended off the back foot
fuller again outside off stump, punched back to Sodhi
slightly short and wide, easily played away to the sweeper off the back foot
short delivery attempted, gets high enough but not much pace, the batsman gets under it without any hassle
full and wide outside the off stump, gentle away shape again, pushed to cover off the front foot
good stuff from Elliott, Chakabva tries to work it through the leg side but flicks it from well outside off stump to mid-on off the front foot. Good probing lines from Elliott
good length outside off, Chakabva opts to let it go on this occasion
flicked in the air to midwicket off the front foot, Elliott sticks with the full length outside off
tucked away off his pads to deep square leg
well bowled, fuller inducing the drive, Chibhabha gets on the front foot and drills it down to long-off

big appeal and given! Bowls it fuller on middle and leg, and not much spin this time. Skids on to Chakabva who tries to work it into the leg side against the turn. He is beaten and strikes him on middle and leg too. Looked a good decision from the umpire. Sodhi gets his first ODI wicket.

edge and just wide of Ross Taylor at slip. Fortuitous for Elton. Pitches it on a good length on off stump and turns away as it takes the outside edge which doesn't evade Taylor by much. Runs down to the third man boundary
fuller on middle and leg, Chigumbura works it off his pads towards midwicket
fuller on off stump, good stuff from Sodhi too. Blocked off the front foot by Chibhabha
a bit too full on this occasion, almost a yorker in fact. Chibhabha digs it out off the front foot to point
away movement from a full length, driven back to the bowler off the front foot
slightly shorter length but good again from Elliott, no room for Chigumbura, pushed to cover
full on off stump, kept a little low too, steered to point off the front foot
much fuller and wider, driven to cover again

gone again, the away movement gets him. Elliott was not providing him with too much room, this one isn't too much different. Chigumbura prods on the front foot with no feet movement and it takes a thin outside edge, which hits Ronchi's gloves but bobbles up for Taylor to take. Good stuff from Elliott and New Zealand.
full on middle which is pushed well off the front foot to cover, Williams off the mark.
good stride from Williams, fuller and pushed across the left-hander but the stride smothers any spin, hit to cover
fuller again outside off, driven to cover positively
slightly short and wide, cut away off the back foot in front of point
drifts on with the angle, good stuff from Sodhi, a tad shorter though. Pushed back off the back foot
positive shot, and he is rewarded for it. Skips down the track and belts it over mid-on. Got well to the pitch of the ball and struck it well too
a tad wide again and short too, easily picked off to point by Chibhabha with the cut.
outside edge, thick one too. Full and swinging away from the off stump, Chibhabha tries to cut it to cover but gets a thick edge which flies down to third man.
some more movement for Elliott, coming in to the left-hander off a fuller length, pushed to mid-off
moves in to Williams again off a slightly full length, punched well past the bowler to mid-off, who dives and stops it from beating him
full and wide outside the off stump, driven with intent to mid-off off the back foot
errs on his line and length on this occasion, neatly worked off his pads to square leg
slightly too full outside off, Williams gets forward and elegantly drives towards sweeper for one
well landed, on a good length on middle and drifts on to Williams who blocks solidly
goes a touch wide and short, Williams jumps on the back foot and cuts off the back foot to point
flatter and skids on to Chibhabha, he reads it well though and turns it off his pads to the deep midwicket region and they scamper back for two

legspinner's dream ball, absolutely terrific, tosses it up on middle and induces Chibhabha to come out of his crease as he tries to work it through the leg side, it spins away from him exaggeratively and beats the outside edge. Chibhabha is well outside his crease and Ronchi doesn't have much to do but does it well. Awesome delivery
not a bad shot for Raza to begin, gets down on one knee and sweeps in the air where no one is there at square leg
some more spin, tosses it up on middle and leg and beats Williams' forward defense as it rips past his inside edge, struck him well outside leg though
back of a length from Elliott and outside the off stump, defended off the front foot
fuller without much movement on off and middle, almost beats Raza's defense though. He gets bat down in time though and it rolls away to square leg
whipped off his pads towards square leg
well worked away, slightly wide outside off, Raza waits for it to swing and turns it to midwicket for one
attempts the bouncer again to change things up, doesn't get high enough, pulled off the front foot to fine leg

nice shot, well played, waits for it to swing and plays it late off the back foot towards deep midwicket, beats mid-on and they can easily come back for three. Good batting from Raza. Key is to play Elliott as late as possible.
good use of the feet from Raza, Sodhi won't mind it though. Tosses it up wide outside off, he skips down the track and belts it over cover with the spin
uses his feet again, this time to smother the spin. He advances and defends
another couple of steps down the track, tries to heave it over mid-off but not enough connection, hit it along the ground to mid-off
tossed up outside off, blocked to cover off the front foot
waits for the turn and cuts it with adequate timing to the sweeper, a bit short on that occasion from Sodhi
flights it on middle and leg, punched back to Sodhi off the front foot. Lots of turn for Sodhi
good-looking shot from Raza. Back of a length outside the off stump, punched well in front of his eyes to sweeper cover
short and wide this time, Williams is able to slap it off the front foot towards deep cover for one
pulled this time off the front foot, good shot again, Henry tries to bang it in outside off but doesn't get too high
beautiful from Williams. Waits for the full ball to come to him and drives delectably to the sweeper
tries the bouncer, very very short and called wide. Well over the batsman's head
swatted away off his ribs off the back foot to fine leg, a bit too short from Henry. Good batting from the pair
well worked away from Williams, slower ball outside the off stump, a bit too slow in fact, glided off the face of the bat down to third man
flighted but below the batsman's eye line, lands it on off and middle, driven back to Sodhi
slightly wider outside the off stump, tossed up again, punched off the front foot to cover
a bit too full, Williams stays in his crease and guides it to third man with an open face
good use of the feet again, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it well towards cover
beats him with his variations, the googly from Sodhi, Williams stays in his crease and checks his drive and it lobs up agonisingly just over cover. Lucky break for Williams.
drills the flighted delivery to long-off
good length delivery on a fourth stump line, steered to point off the front foot
off stump line this time, good over so far from Henry, back of a length again, pushed off to square leg

missed opportunity for New Zealand. Should have been taken. Short ball on middle stump and Raza wants to pull and connects well but hits it in the air needlessly and the fielder is a few metres inside the boundary and misjudges the catch too. Another agonising lob over him, lands inside the boundary too
driven to cover off the back foot, good length delivery well outside the off stump
slower delivery on middle, Raza cautiously defends to midwicket
loopy bouncer outside off, well over the batsman's head. Tennis ball like bounce
controls the pull this time. Short and pulled away to square leg
too short, outside off, clipped off his pads past widwicket with ease
too full again, yorker, Williams digs it out
comes in with the angle, worked off his pads to square leg
ripper! beats the outside edge easily, pitched on of stump and turned a lot to beat the edge. Great delivery
full on middle, patted back to the bowler
slower and on middle again, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
angled into the left-hander from round the wicket, Williamson goes back and forces the ball through midwicket
a loud appeal for body before wicket because the batsman plays no shot after moving outside the line of off stump, that ball hit him on the stomach because he was crouching
defended on the front foot
played off the back foot through the covers
bowled slow through the air outside off, Williams moves back to swat it through the off side but mis-times it, the fielder at cover does well to cut it off too
pushed off the back foot in front of point for a single
short ball, and it sorts of sits up for the batsman, Williams is nicely balanced as he pulls in front of square leg
defended from the crease on the leg side, short of a length ball that was
good length, pitching on middle and leg, angling across the batsman, played with an open face towards point
full, nearly in the blockhole, Williams digs it out back to the bowler, McClenaghan tumbles as he fields on his followthrough, Raza tumbles to get back into his crease at the bowler's end
good length outside off, brisk pace from McClenaghan, Williams lets it go
short of a length, just outside off, Williams waits in his crease and opens the face to steer the ball behind point
tight line and length on off, defended on the front foot
driven to long on for a single
tossed up outside off with more air, driven on the front foot through cover point
tries to late cut it from close to off stump but misses
uses the angle into him from round the wicket to slow sweep to deep square leg
moves deep into the crease as the ball spins into him and then uses the angle to dab the ball off his pads towards square leg
Raza gets into a bit of a tangle as he tries to pull a short ball, adjusts nicely in the end by getting off his toes and playing a short-arm pull
this time he's ready and waiting for the short ball, Raza gets into position early and winds up to unleash a powerful pull in front of midwicket, simply slapped it into the gap
McClenaghan goes fuller around off, Raza stays in his crease and opens the face to steer behind point
short of a length with a bit of lift outside off, Williams begins to poke but then pulls his bat away from the line

that's a top edge and the ball falls short of the fielder running in from fine leg, was Sodhi slow in running towards the ball? That was a brute of a short ball, rising quickly from short of a length, Williams tried to hook but was in a bad position to play it from outside off stump
a full toss outside off, Raza leans forward to drive it towards deep cover
worked off the pads to square
defended on the front foot towards cover
pushed off the front foot into the off side
waits on the back foot and leans back to dab the ball towards point
uses the feet to advance this time and punches the ball to long off
goes back into his crease and is then cramped for room by one that turns quite sharply, Raza adjusts well and defends
short ball outside off, slapped off the back foot to long on for a single
steps out and defends on the off side
bowled flat and straight on middle stump, defended from the crease with a straight bat
moves back and towards leg and opens the face to steer the ball towards point
that's a long hop outside off from Williamson, Williams goes back and slaps hard, Guptill fumbles at cover
defended from the crease
moves back in his crease and nudges the ball off his pads to short fine leg
tries to dab the ball on the leg side again but makes no proper contact
Raza strides forward and pushes a full ball through point for a single
stays on the back foot and cuts the ball to point
steps out of the crease and drives uppishly towards long off
bowled flat and angled into the pads, Raza goes back and swats the ball through midwicket
played into the covers off the front foot

what's happened there?! Outstanding fielding from Martin Guptill. Raza had gone on the back foot to push a ball towards mid-on, and Williams set off for a run from the non-striker's end. Guptill came sprinting in from midwicket to dive full length and cut off the shot. Seeing that, Raza sent Williams back ... Guptill was still flat on the ground on his stomach when he back-handed the ball along the ground and hit the stumps direct to run Williams out by miles
played on the off side
an appeal for lbw but that's missing leg
nudged off the pads behind square
defended on the leg side
defended on the front foot towards the off side
played from the crease towards point
pushed from the crease towards mid on
defended towards mid-on once again
moves back as the ball spins into him and hits it into the covers
nudged off the front foot towards midwicket
edged and did that carry? Don't think it did. Sodhi looped the leg break on to middle and spun it sharply, catching the outside edge. Fell short of slip
defended on the back foot
pushed into the covers where the fielder dives to his left to field and then throws to the keeper, the batsman had to scramble back and dive. It was Guptill again
pushes forward to defend but is beaten by the flighted legbreak
pushed off the front foot into the covers
bowled full on middle stump, the slog sweep is mis-timed through midwicket
tossed up on off, worked off his pads to square leg
good flight from McCullum, solidly blocked back
too slow from McCullum, easily tucked off the pads to square legs with plenty of time
advances down the track and drives to mdiwicket with the turn
blocks the flighted delivery back to the bowler
skips down the track and trys to loft it against the spin but skews it of the inside half of the bat down to long-on
flatter and quicker on middle stump, whipped wristily off his pads to square leg
good flight, well landed too, just outside the off stump, a good positive drive finds the gap at cover

got 'em. Another legspinners beauty. Tosses it up beautifully outside the off stump, Cremer attempts an expansive drive and flays his hands at it, instead he gets a thick outside edge that flies to second slip who takes a sharp catch. Good captaincy from Williamson.
flatter on leg stump, just a hint of turn, hits Utseya high on the thigh pad
slower flighted delivery, patted to cover off the front foot
too full this time, opens the face of the bat and guides it on the ground to the slip cordon
beautifully done by Raza, great shot. Got to the pitch of the ball to the flighted delivery and meets it with the full face of the bat and lofts it easily well over long-off
goes flatter, drifts down the leg side
another wide, mis-directs his line again, lands it on middle and it spins down the leg side
a bit wider outside off stump, Raza goes back and cuts the back of a length delivery to point
defends the flighted delivery back down the pitch
flatter this time, Utseya tries to work it to the leg but misses

another wicket. Poor shot from Utseya. Short and wide outside the off stump, turning in. Utseya rocks back and tries to cut the ball turning in, he can only get  a thin outside edge which is extremely well taken by Ronchi
huge stride forward, good solid defense off the tossed up delivery
tossed up again above the batsman's eye line, defended off the front foot
slightly wider, flighted delivery. Raza lets it go
some more flight which is met by a good, solid forward defensive shot
a repeat of the previous ball, tossed up on off stump, patted into the cover region
googly this time, but mis-directed, Raza tries to sweep but it is too short and he improvises well, gets a bit of bat onto it and it races down the fine leg boundary. Fifty for Raza too
well played, farming the strike, waits for the tossed up delivery to spin, opens the face of the bat and guides it to sweeper cover for a single to keep strike
flat and quick on leg stump, whipped off his pads to deep midwicket
well flighted, above the batsman's eye line, well outside off, driven to cover
flatter this time around off, guided behind point off the back foot
short on middle, easy runs for Raza. He goes back and pulls powerfully to square leg
blocks the flighted delivery back down the track
tossed up again, patted back to the bowler again
beautiful shot, picks his spot and deposits it where he wants to, slower delivery outside the off stump, Raza puts one foot forward and lofts it easily over mid-off
good length delivery on a fourth stump line, swatted away to cover without much feet movement
quick offcutter on off stump, awkwardly driven to the sweeper cover
good length delivery on a fourth stump line, opened the face of the bat to point
well played, bangs it in short and it comes back in with the angle, he waits for it and guides it down to third man
too short, should have been put away, Raza sees it and realises his opportunity for runs but is a bit too eager, plays way too early and ends up toe-ending it down to mid-on
flighted again as he is trying to invite the drive, Panyangara plays it well with bat and pad together, works it to point
driven to cover
worked off his pads to backward square leg
slides on with the arm to beat the defensive half-prod outside off
drifts down leg and punished, not very convincingly swept but he gets enough bat on it and finds the gap behind square with decent timing, checking all the boxes for a boundary
flighted on off stump, driven to the cover off the front foot
quick delivery on middle, McClenaghan tumbles on his follow through, Raza gets back and checks it defensively to long-on
good batting again, watching the ball pretty well. Waits for the short ball to rise, steers it to third man for a single
hits him this time, right under the arm. It is short again and he tries to pull over midwicket but is early on it again, he is beaten and gets struck on his ribs under the arm
another extra, drifts down the leg side and called wide
fuller delivery and pushed across the right-hander, he drives it to mid-off with no timing, but times it just well enough to scamper through for one
good-looking drive from the No 10, pushed across the batsman on a good length around off, pushed down to mid-off
expansive drive attempted, slightly wide outside off. No gap, no timing and no runs
too full on off stump, punched back to KW, a slight misfield allows them the single
flatter but slow, Panyangara tries to work it on the leg but misses and is beaten on the pads
swept powerfully to backward square leg, a slight misfield sllows them two
full on middle, punched back to KW who fields this time
slower and shorter on middle stump, worked away to midwicket
flighted delivery and blocked with a lot of intent
full on a fourth stump line, in the hitting arc but Raza drives it powerfully to mid-off and rushes through for one. Clearly trusting Panyangara's batting ability
and why shouldn't he? Good shot to mid-off the front foot with a good positive strike
slower delivery outside off, heaved away off the front foot to deep square leg who is quick on the ball to prevent two
great shot Tinashe! Cross-seam delivery outside off, a good stride forward and launches one over the bowler's head. Straight, clean boundary
and a good follow-up too, Henry avoids the full length, slightly shorter and run off the face off the bat down to third man
well played from Raza, opens the face of the bat deliberately to get it down to third man again to keep strike
well bowled, tossed up but dips on the batsman, patted back to the bowler
dropped. Easy catch, Wheeler made an easy catch look tough, slower and hit in the air to cover where he takes it too easy as it dips on him and he spills it
he is content to defend the ball off the front foot on this occasion
pats the slower delivery on leg to midwicket
drifts on leg stump, helped down to fine leg with a swat

oh another superb shot. McClenaghan continues to go short, Tinashe sways out of the line and guides it down to third man with a bent back, great technique, good placement. Misfielded by Sodhi on the boundary too
tries to repeat the shot, guides it to gully off the back foot this time
hits him high on the stomach, back of a length on leg, he tries to work it off his pads but misses

some more fortune for Zimbabwe and bad fielding from New Zealand. Short on middle, Panyangara pulls in the air to square leg in the air who runs around and doesn't attempt the catch or try to stop the boundary, goes through him
inside edge down to fine leg, ful land wide and the expansive drive is met by the inside edge
fuller on middle and leg stump, squirted down to long-on off the front foot
short and wide outside off, tries to pull it over midiwkcte but hits it to midwicket
attempts to cut the short delivery, but he is beaten
another short, quick delivery on off, pulled to midwicket
pushed wider and wider from the off stump deliberately, cut away to point for one
very slow this time, Raza gives himself room and swats it out to the sweeper cover
flighted delivery on this occasion, Panyangara guides it to third man off the front foot
slower bouncer on middle and leg, loops over Raza, it is called wide which brings up 200 for Zimbabwe
connected with that though, shorter ball on middle, easy hit for Raza, pulls it high in the air over behind square leg and clears the boundary by a few metres. Good hit
full delivery on middle stump, he clears on foot and tries to heave it down the ground but ends up slicing it to long-off the front foot
another short delivery, well directed this time, Panyangara gets across his stumps and is beaten down the leg side
slower, full delivery, Panyangara attempts to slog over midwicket, squirts it off the inner half to square leg
big expansive heave. But misses. Slower delivery, very slow. Raza is through the shot way too early and doesn't connect
low full toss outside the off stump, he gets bat down on it and pats in to the cover region to keep strike
slow on leg stump, Raza gets down on knee and reverse paddles it away to sweeper point
ooh, smashed back to KW, who drops it but saves four, very hard catch. Full delivery, Panyangara comes forward and smashes it back
well played, skips down the track and plays with soft hands into the cover region for an easy two
that is huge, absolutely massive. Slow on middle stump at the death, Raza picks it and deposits over the midwicket region for a huge six
another massive six. What hitting from Raza, too slow from KW and waits for the ball to reach him and flat-bats it over square leg for another huge six. Superb striking
finally goes wide outside off, Raza gets some bat on it down to third man
good ball, low full toss. Worked well into the gap at midwicket and they race back for two. Nathan McCullum is too slow on it.
great ball, speared in the blockhole, Raza can only dig out to point for one
great ball, full yorker on middle, squirted off to point who makes a good, diving stop to prevent it from passing him
another superb ball, very low full toss on leg stump, smashed though but straight to square leg whose return is swift
low full toss and hit through the off side by Tinashe, easy two for Zimbabwe, maybe three of they sprinted but they didn't go through. Happy with the one.

no ball. A bit too high above the waist and hit in the air to midwicket where it lands in front of midwicket to bring up Raza's century. Absolutely brilliant innings. Free hit off the last ball of the over
another full delivery, and drilled down to long-off. They sprint back for two but the throw is good back to the keeper and he is well short.

inn2.comm: drifts on Guptill's pads immediately, no movement. Guptill is late on the flick and is rapped on the pads. Going well down the leg side
gets it right this time, back of a length just outside off, Guptill ramps it down to third man off the open face
fuller delivery around the off stump, Latham sees no reason to play and lets it go. Lots of bounce after it passed the bat

oh shot, slightly wider outside off stump, cut away well behind point. Gives him the room and he flays his hands at it to beat point. A misfield at the third man boundary allows it to go to the boundary
off stump line on a good length, Latham can't do much with that and hence pats it back to cover
good end, just a tad full on a fifth stump line. Latham lets it go through to the keeper
not a great start though, drifts on his pads and Guptill doesn't miss out this time, waits for the ball to come to him and plays late through square leg. Easy three, no trouble
full and a bit too wide, absolutely no reason to play for Latham. It is left easily
good-looking shot, a bit straighter this time, closer to the off stump, Latrham drives the fuller delivery to mid-on with a good stride
a hint of away shape on that occasion, but too wide to cause any trouble. Guptill gets a good forward stride and leaves
too wide down leg, easy pickings for Guptill. Would have been called wide if he hadn't tickled that down to fine leg
fuller delivery and a touch wide, Latham could have left that too but gets his front foot forward and guides to point
better line, makes Guptill play but there isn't much seam movement or swing. Guptill punches off the front foot to mid-off
what a great delivery on this occasion! Looked a great decision from the umpire, pitches on middle stump and hits him high on the pad and travels to the keepr. Huge appeal, but not given.
fuller delivery again, this time Guptill defends to point
full on middle and leg, another good front foot stride and turned away with the angle towards mid-on
a bit shorter on off stump, defended with intent off the back foot
oh shot. Crashed through the off side, short and wide and deserved to be punished. He smashes it off the back foot to cover point but a great diving stop prevents it from going through
pitched outside leg and coming back in to middle, a thick inside edge from Latham gets it down to fine leg. The bat came down with a bit of an angle on that occasion
on Guptill's pad again, gets his front foot way across but gets his bat down in time and flicks it to short fine leg
a bit of room there, Guptill throws his hands at it, maybe a bit too hard and finds cover point
some more room for Guptill outside the off stump, gets on top of the bounce and guides it behind point, some more good fielding from Zimbabwe
good length delivery on a fourth stump line, well defended with a giant stride.
elegant shot but picks the fielder at mid-off. Slightly fuller and asking to be driven, but Latham can't pierce the gap
awful delivery, easy runs for Guptill. On his pads on leg stump, Guptill gets forward and flicks it easily through square leg. Races across for four
decent comeback, back of a length around off stump, patted down to point
fuller length around off stump again, Guptill gets forward and drives to mid-on without great timing
whipped off his pads to square leg for an easy single. Not great bowling. There has to be a string of consistent deliveries. All over the place at the moment are Zimbabwe's opening bowlers
better, much better. Top-of-off stump line and at back of a length, blocked back to the bowler
drifts on his pads again, worked away in the air to square leg, falls well short though.
worked it off his pads again to midwicket, gets off strike easily
picked off his pads to square leg, runs coming all too easily for the openers. Looks like the bowlers are struggling to adapt to the left-right combination
short and wide this time, Latham walks across his stumps a couple of steps and slaps it to point
hit to point in the air but lands just short, wide outside off again and Latham square drives but straight to backward point
on his pads again, clipped to mid-on which is followed by a quick single
wild swipe! Totally unnecessary from Guptill with all the poor bowling. It is full and outside off, Guptill skips a couple of steps down and tries to loft down the ground. No connection, just a heave
overpitched outside off, should have been dispatched. He drives but cover is able to get across and cut it off
good stuff. Tight line and length around off, Guptill cannot do anything with those, he guides it to point
fuller and quick with a hint of away swing, Guptill drives it and it skews off the outer half of the bat in the gap behind backward and cover point
good length with a touch of room, square-driven to point off the front foot
slower offcutter from Mpofu, decent change-up. Latham waits for it to come to him before working it to square leg
back of a length delivery around off stump, Latham stands tall and punches off the back foot to point
easy stuff for Guptill. Short, wide and Guptill won't miss out on those. He waits for it to spin and flat-bats it past cover point for four very easy runs
full delivery this time, driven down to long-off
comes in with the angle, Latham clips it off his pads which beats short midwicket
i'll take four, says Guptill. Short and wide and sits up for Guptill, who rocks back on the back foot and crashes it wide off mid-on. Easy runs for Guptill
fuller this time on off stump, driven off the front foot to cover
he gets it finally, tossed up outside off and spins away from Guptill who gets a forward stride in and leaves
slingy variation from Mpofu, back of a length on middle, clipped off his pads to square leg
slightly wider outside off providing just enough room for Latham to guide it down to third man with the open face
bangs it in but doesn't get too high. Sits up again for Guptill, who rolls his wrists on it to keep it down and pull it away to square leg
a spinning offcutter, well bowled, pitches on off stump and moves a lot to beat the outside edge of Latham. Good variation from Mpofu.
another spinning offcutter. Latham picks it well though and meets the ball with a solid defense with a straight bat

and a treble of slower offcutters. He gets a thick inside edge which rolls down to fine leg while just missing the stumps. They come back for two, but it is just a bit too close for comfort. He makes his ground with a full-length dive.
tucks it away off his pads without much trouble to deep midwicket
swept very powerfully from latham, drags it from well outside off to get it to deep square leg. Good shot.
short and wide again, should have been put away too. He is too eager for it and hits it off the toe-end to mid-on with his pull
flatter and quicker, comes in with the arm too, cut away to short third man
driven to long-off with a good stride off the front foot
greater sweep this time. Gets down on one knee very quickly and powerfully sweeps it in the air into the vacant midwicket region
doesn't start well with his first ball, a bit short spinning away from the off stump, Guptill rocks back and cuts it past backward point
ripper! absolute gem of a delivery. Pitches outside leg and rips across Guptill's outside edge
slightly short again, easily cut away to point by Guptill
short on leg stump, easily worked off his pads to square leg
tosses it up but ends in a full toss, drilled down to long-on
beautifully done, fuller on middle and spins away again. Guptill gets a big stride and taps it to point off the front foot
darts it in on leg stump, clipped off his pads to backward square leg
quicker and flatter, pushed off to cover off the front foot
darted it in again on leg stump, worked away to square leg
fired down leg side, no turn and called wide
quicker delivery on middle and leg, inside half of the bat from Guptill down to fine leg
too straight, easy runs for Latham. Easily worked off his pads to square leg, way too easy for these two
straight delivery on off stump, driven to cover off the front foot
googly this time, Guptill did not pick that and smiles ruefully, pitched on middle and goes on to leg, just about gets bat on that
fuller delivery on middle, blocked back to the bowler
there is the loose delivery, full and wide, drilled down to long-off, good fielding prevents two
neatly flicked off his pads to deep midwicket
well bowled, tossed up on off stump, driven off the front foot to cover
a bit overpitched and Guptill has no issues in smashing it down to long-off for one
drifts in to his pads, Guptill misses his flick and his hit on the pads, a muted appeal but sliding down leg, it rolls off the pads to third man for an extra
superb shot, picked his gap and executed well. A bit too full and wide, Latham gets a good forward stride and lofts it over cover where no one is present
flat and quick, pushed down to long-on off the back foot
driven to cover off the front foot
fired down leg, would have been called wide, but Guptill chooses to flick it down to square leg
fuller outside off, square-driven off the back foot to point
full delivery outside off stump, Guptill tries to force it into the off side but not enough bat on it
hit to cover off the front foot
clipped off his apds to deep midwicket, good diving stop prevents the boundary
full on leg stump, patted into the leg side
too full but Latham chooses to sweep, doesn't get all of that but gets enough to get it down to fine leg
slower on off stump, patted back to the bowler off the back foot
tucks the straightish ball to midwicket
pushes the length ball into the covers
goes back in the crease for the ball with some room and cuts it just past backward point
angling in towards middle and leg, Latham pushes it back
onto the pads now and it's clipped to midwicket for one
slower and angling down leg, helped to fine leg for one
flighted and straight full toss, Guptill lofts that down the ground over mid-on for an easy four. Just had to clear that one fielder
better delivery, was on length around off and turning away, Guptill pressed forward to defend
reaches out and drives the ball with the turn into the covers for one
flighted and fullish around off, driven down to mid-off for a quick single
short ball on leg, hardly any turn and it's pulled to deep fine leg for one
tries to sweep the ball with the turn bit it's shorter than he thinks and is beaten. The ball turns in sharply from outside off and he's hit around the neck
flat delivery outside off, pushed into the covers off the front foot
on length on off now, pushed back to Utseya
drifting down the leg side, it's clipped off the pads to midwicket
gets a thickish outside edge just past the bowler for one
fullish on the pads, driven down easily to long-on for one
flat delivery on middle and leg, worked with the angle to midwicket
sweeps this full delivery from middle to fine leg for one
beats him with the flight and strikes him full on the front pad, but it's hit him outside leg
punches that short of length ball with some power to deep cover for one
full and flighted on leg, it's driven down to long-on off the pads
tries to steer the ball into the covers off the back foot but gets an inner edge back to the bowler
turns the last ball in from outside off, he defends it off the back foot and that's drinks
defends the length delivery into the covers
straighter and a bit fuller, drives that with a straight face down to long-on for a quick second
more towards middle and leg, it's worked down to long-on for one more
angling in towards off, steered down to long-off off the front foot
onto the pads, clipped straight to midwicket
little wide outside off, he guides it to short third man off the back foot
pretty full on the pads, driven down to long-on past the bowler
fair bit of room outside off, he cuts that nicely off the back foot to beat backward point but Williams does well to slide at the boundary to save two
pushes the fuller delivery into the covers for one
almost a stumping chance as Guptill's foot was in the air after the ball went down leg, but he put it back in time
bit of flight outside leg again, tucked to short fine leg with the turn
he sweeps and gets an edge just over the leg slip to bring up his fifty with three. That's his 26th in ODIs
outside off and it's pushed into the covers for one
fullish delivery well outside off, driven away from the body to extra cover
he finds the gap this time, on the leg side, as he clips the ball that was angling in over the midwicket region
just outside off and it's driven into the covers for
on length outside off, driven off the front foot past cover for one more
angling towards the pads, clipped away towards square leg and he brings up his fifty too. Latham's second in ODIs
goes on the back foot and works it with the angle to deep midwicket for one
comes down the track and defends the ball back
it's short, it's wide outside off and Latham cuts it off the back foot to sweeper cover for one
that's too full and Guptill smashes it back down the ground! That nearly hit the umpire on its way, but went for four
goes back and clips the ball towards midwicket for one
tries to clip the ball down leg but it goes for a wide
fullish outside off and he drives it with the turn past cover for one
helps the ball with the turn to square leg
starts with a full straight delivery which is punched back off the front foot. Panyangara partially fields which allows them to run through for one as the ball slowly trickles to mid-on
good length delivery on a fourth stump line, good ball from Tinashe. Punched off the back foot to cover
what a shot. He is extremely quick on the pull, Tinashe bangs it in but doesn't get up and instead sits up for Guptill who pulls emphatically but straight to square leg
tight line around the off stump, solidly defended back to the bowler

great stroke, absolute quality. He slidies it on to off stump and doesn't realise Latham's nimble feet coming at him. He meets it and lofts it beautifully over the midwicket boundary and it travels the distance too. Excellent shot.
tight line on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
wobble delivery to start, his fingers around the seam, not on it. No wobble though. Hit back to the bowler
crashed away off the front foot to sweeper cover off the full delivery outside off
tries the no-hands-on-seam delivery again, no seam movement. Drifts on Latham's pads though who is unable to tickle it to fine leg, gets hit on the thigh pad
a bit too full, smashed down to long-off
the outside edge this time, no slip in place. It is full and a tad wide, Latham drives at it but gets a thick outside edge
Guptill tries to use the pace to beat short third man but there isn't enough pace on it, hits it to third man instead
full delivery on a fourth stump line. Latham stands tall and guides it to point off the front foot
goes over the infield, doesn't get the intended amount of bat on that however. It is fuller on off stump, Latham tries to go over the leg side but skews it again out to square leg
lovely lines and lengths this over from TP. Back of a length just around the off stump. Punched back to the bowler.
short and wide this time, not punished. Guptill tries to go through the off side, where the sweeper is in the circle. Hits it straight to him.

smashed. Clearly made up for the previous ball. Full and straight and belted back powerfully past the bowler, it gets to long-on in no time who misfields while diving and parries it for four. Difficult stop though.
worked away off his pads to square leg
surprised by the bounce there is Guptill. Just a gentle delivery outside off, takes off from a good length and beats Guptill
no missing out there, short, wide and banished from his presence. He picks his gap and cuts it behind point for four. Races across to the boundary
slightly quicker and fuller, driven out to cover
middle and leg line on a good length, Guptill keeps it out off the back foot
easy single. He stays in his crease and punches this length delivery on middle down to long-on.
just a hint of away seam movement, Latham gets on the back foot and defends it out to cover without any trouble
good length delivery on middle and off stump, Guptill drives off the back foot to mid-off
back of a length delivery on a fourth stump line, squirted off to point off the back foot
good delivery again, good length around off, he hits it to mid-off and sets off for a run, makes a closer run easily. Too quick is Martin Guptill
back of a length around off again, good lines, driven back to the bowler
slapped off the front foot to point off the front foot. A bit wider outside off
belts it this time. It is a good line again, but not much pace on it. He skips forward and flat-bats it over mid-on for another easy boundary. Well picked and well-struck.
slower loosener on middle and leg, watchfully played out in to the leg side off the front foot
middle and leg again, patted out to square leg
an inside edge from Guptill now. Slower offcutter from Mpofu, comes back in a touch and takes his edge and then onto his body. Harmlessly rolls away
smashed this time, short on middle. Easy runs again for Guptill. Gets enough bat on the pull and sends it racing away behind square leg
wow. Do not bowl short to this guy. He strays on a shorter length with no pace, Guptill is quick on it and sends it flying over midwicket for another boundary. Running away with it now are these two.
outside off this time, cut down to third man to keep strike
bowled from wide of the crease, fuller and defended into the off side
width and cut away with the room to the sweeper cover for one
pushes the full delivery to long-on off the front foot
fuller and closer tpo the off stump, blocked without trouble from Guptill, not much spin
crashed through the off side but hits it to ocver who misfields and gives them a single. Slightly wider outside the off stump on that occasion
chooses to sweep it and executes well, wide outside off and dragged behind square for an easy two
picks his gap and puts the ball in that gap. Full and wide, Guptill square drives off the front foot and with no sweeper, it races across to the boundary
good ball, tight around off, Guptill defends off the front foot towards point
slower ball which is wide outside off stump, could have put that anywhere he liked but chooses to guide it down to third man for one. Loose delivery again
oh, whatta shot. He waits for this slow, full delivery to come to him and leans on it and drives delectably to the cover boundary. Superb stroke, real quality.
slower ball outside off, guided down to third man once more. No trouble at all
slower offcutter again. Absolutely no trouble for these set batsmen. Waits for it to come to him and guides it to point off the back foot.
powerful sweep but also waits enough to find the gap behind square, well played from Latham. Easy shot with the left-handed bowler over the wicket
swept again, this time to fine leg who cuts it off
a hint of turn, bowled from wide from the crease again and it grips just a touch. Guptill gets on the front foot and squirts it out to point
tucks it off his pads towards square leg for one
blocked off the front foot with no trouble, it is fuller on off stump
slightly flatter around off, Guptill skews it off to fine leg off the inside edge
darts it in on middle and leg, driven back to him
full again, patted to cover
and a repeat. Driven to cover off the front foot with a straight bat
picks the gap at long-off now, it is a bit slower and he waits for it to punch it to long-off
too full this time, drilled down to long-off
neatly flicked off his pads in the vacant square leg gap. By the time, the midwicket fielder gets around, there is an easy brace
too short and too slow, Guptill waits on it and pulls to midwicket off the front foot
played away down to fine leg with the spin off the back foot
slow on middle and leg, Guptill stays on the back foot and smashes it to midwicket for one
rank long hop, should have been put away over the boundary, bowls it short and slow, Latham jumps on the back foot and pulls it to the vacant square leg region again
a bit leg side-ish again, clipped down to the short fine leg fielder
flicked off his pads to square leg
too full on his pads, whipped to midwicket
similar ball, similar shot, slight misfield at midwicket on this occasion and they can easily complete the single
good shot again, full and wide and asking to be hit. Guptill says no problem and belts it to wide of long-off who can dive but not stop it
again on the pads, worked off to fine leg
slightly wider outside off this time, Latham cuts in the air but lands well in short of point.
much straighter, tight lines around off. Blocked back to Utseya
Cremer pitches it well outside the leg stump from around the wicket, Guptill sweeps it well behind square and races back for two
too full down leg and another sweep for Guptill to reach his eighth ODI century. Great innings from the man. Punished almost all the poor deliveries
quality again from Latham. He comes forward and meets it as it pitches, lofts it with the turn and beats the fielder at long-on. Goes over by a couple of metres
defended off the back foot towards cover
picked off his pads towards square leg for one
googly from around the off stump, but Guptill on 100, finds absolutely no trouble in defending it off the back foot
pushed off the front foot to midwicket, good diving stop
fuller delivery, driven back to the bowler again
shorter length on off, cut away but to point
a bit wider and just the room Latham needed to drive it down to long-off to take him to 96
a bit fuller around off, pushed to mid-off with no trouble
pushed to midwicket off the front foot, a bit too full from Utseya
slower ball on middle and leg, turned off his pads to midwicket. 200 stand for NZ's openers, excellent stuff
full from around the stumps, Guptill clears one leg to make room and drive it wide off cover towards long-off for an easy brace
flighted on leg stump, Guptill gets forward to defend
too wide down leg this time, a lot of turn but still ends up being called a wide
stays on the back foot and blocks this full delivery back to the bowler
powerfully swept down to fine leg
comes down the track but Cremer slows this up down the leg which stops on Latham who improvises well without panicking to work it to square leg
too full on middle, drilled down to long-on
full and he drives it down to long-on off the front foot to get to his maiden ODI century. Great innings Tom Latham, some amazing shots in it. Well-deserved century.
full on off stump, steered to point
whipped wristily off his pads to deep midwicket
a bit short and wide, cut away in the gap in the cover region
a bit shorter on middle, Guptill blocks it off the front foot towards third man
Latham gets down on one knee to sweep it over fine leg, not much connection, rolls off his pads to fine leg
clears one leg and drives it with the spin to cover
pitched outside off and spins back in, Latham rocks back and plays it late but hits it to the bowler
connects with the sweep this time, good connection too, it is too slow to cause much trouble. Latham gets down on a knee and lofts the sweep over fine leg
a bit short and Latham rocks back again, punched down to long-on
well bowled, he is still tossing it up to his credit, but it is too short and Guptill can get back and cut to point
a bit short first up on middle and leg, pulled well off the front foot to square leg
fuller and flatter, Guptill blocks on the front foot
skids on with the arm from a fuller length, Guptill gets back and punches back to the bowler
slower on middle, pushed back to the bowler
slightly wider outside off and Guptill stays back and cuts to point
this time he gets the gap, a bit wider, Guptill rocks back and cuts it to the sweeper cover
huge six! Absolutely massive. A slow, flighted googly and Guptill picks it. That is all he needed, put one foot forward and slogs it over long-on for a humongous six
follows it with a bit of caution, defends the fuller delivery off the front foot
slow turn once more, Guptill jumps back and turns it to midwicket against the spin
slow turn once more, drifts on his pads and Latham turns it to short fine leg
opens the face of the bat to deflect the full delivery wide off point
tossed up again on middle, Guptill drives with soft hands towards long-off, halfway through the first run they realise there is an east two on offer and they make it easily too.
flat, quick and wide. Latham is beaten on the cut
short on middle and leg, Latham pulls off the front foot towards square leg
flat and quick down leg, Latham tries to sweep but no one can get to that. It beats the keeper as well and runs away to the boundary for five extras which is good enough for NZ to level the series.
